revised_title: Investigation of Coagulation in Sea Urchin Perivisceral Fluid
tldr: The author investigates the coagulation of the perivisceral fluid of the sea urchin and discovers that it is similar to the coagulation process in vertebrate blood. The coagulation material is not like fibrin found in vertebrate blood but is more closely related to mucin. The study provides insights into the cellular and molecular processes involved in the coagulation of echinoderm fluids.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular Biology
